-f, --format: use a specific output format, the default is: progress-bar/dump on CI
-s, --staged: add staged files when in git repository
--fix: apply fixes of errors to code
--plugins: a comma-seperated list of plugins to use
--enable: edits the project's .putout.json file to toggle on a specific rule there. Note that  this parameter can not be used together with --fix, instead it only edits the .putout.json file.
--disable: edits the project's .putout.json file to toggle off a specific rule there
--enable-all: edits the project's .putout.json file to turn on all rules applicable to your current codebase
--disable-all: edits the project's .putout.json file to turn off all rules applicable to your current codebase
--match: read .putout.json and convert "rules" to "match" using pattern
